name: Hawker Center for Integrative Medicine - COVID Vaccine Clinic
address: 1750 112th Avenue Northeast, STE C-102, Bellevue WA, 98004
info:
At the Hawker Center, we provide a warm oasis of peace and comfort, treating our patients and their stories with patience and respect. Imagine a spa-like atmosphere where a highly-trained doctor or nurse is administrating the COVID19 vaccination. That’s the Hawker Center difference.
***We currently are providing the 1st and 2nd doses of MODERNA.*** Please sign up for an appointment time.  Please arrive no more than 10 minutes prior to your appointment time. Expect to stay for 15 minutes after you receive your vaccine to monitor for any adverse reaction.***If you would like to find out more information about our clinic, please visit our website at www.hawkerhealth.com***
special: If you are signing up for a second dose, you must get the same vaccine brand as your first dose.

name: Clark County PH- COVID Vaccine Site
address: Yacolt Fire Station Admin Building 300 West Hoag Street, Yacolt WA, 98675
vaccines: Janssen COVID-19 Vaccine, Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine
info:
The Yacolt Fire Station vaccination site is providing the Johnson & Johnson vaccine and the Pfizer vaccine. The Johnson & Johnson vaccine requires only one dose; you will not need to return for a second dose. The Pfizer vaccine requires two doses; if this is your first dose, you will need to return for a second dose.

Please do not arrive more than 10 minutes before your scheduled appointment. Arriving too early can lead to longer waiting times. 

You will be asked to remain at the vaccination site for 15 to 30 minutes after being vaccinated. Medical personnel will be monitoring you for possible reactions. Severe reactions are rare. 

What to bring:
•	Identification: If you have identification or some other proof of your date of birth, please bring it. This helps to ensure registration information is accurate. But ID is not required for vaccination. 
•	Face covering: Face coverings must be worn while at the COVID-19 vaccination site. 
•	Please wear a short-sleeved shirt or shirt with loose sleeves that can be pulled up. You will receive your COVID-19 vaccine in your upper arm. 

El sitio de vacunación de la estación de bomberos de Yacolt está proporcionando la vacuna Johnson & Johnson y la vacuna Pfizer. La vacuna de Johnson & Johnson requiere solo una dosis; no necesitará regresar para una segunda dosis. La vacuna Pfizer requiere dos dosis; si esta es su primera dosis, deberá regresar para una segunda dosis.

Por favor, no llegue más de 10 minutos antes de su cita. Llegar con demasiada antelación puede causar tiempos de espera más largos.

Se le pedirá que permanezca en el centro de vacunación de 15 a 30 minutos después de ser vacunado. El personal médico le vigilará para detectar posibles reacciones. Las reacciones graves son poco frecuentes.  

Qué debe traer:
•	Identificación: Si tiene un documento de identitificación, o documento con fecha de nacimiento, por favor tráigalo. Esto ayuda a asegurar que la información de registro es correcta. Pero no es necesario presentar un documento de identidad para la vacunación.  
•	Prenda para cubrirse la cara: Debe llevar una prenda para cubrirse la cara mientras esté en el centro de vacunación de COVID-19.  
•	Por favor, lleve una camisa de mangas cortas o una camisa con mangas sueltas que se puedan subir. Usted recibirá la vacuna contra la COVID-19 en la parte superior del brazo.
special: If you are signing up for a second dose, you must get the same vaccine brand as your first dose.

name: Yakima County Health District COVID Vaccination Site
info: ***PFIZER VACCINATIONS*** !!!!VACUNAS DE PFIZER!!! Enter fairgrounds through Gate 15 off of Pacific Avenue. Be prepared to show confirmation of your appointment or you may experience a slightly longer wait. Masks are required. Please wear clothing which allows access to your shoulder. Vaccinations at this site are reserved for people who live and/or work in Washington State. All Minors age 17 and Under must go to the Walk-in Tent located by the Admin Building. Ingresar por la puerta 15 en la avenida Pacífico. Se requieren máscaras. Por favor, use ropa que permita acceso a su brazo. Las vacunas en este sitio están reservadas para las personas que viven o trabajan en el estado de Washington. Todos los menores de 17 años o menos deben ir a la carpa sin cita ubicada junto al edificio administrativo.*** PFIZER VACCINATIONS*** !!!!VACUNAS DE PFIZER!!!
special: If you are signing up for a second dose, you must get the same vaccine brand as your first dose.

name: Yakima County Health District COVID Vaccination Site
info: ***1st & 2nd DOSE PFIZER VACCINATIONS!!!!***!!!!VACUNAS DE PRIMERA Y SEGUNDA DOSIS PFIZER!!! The vaccination clinic will take place at Yakima Valley Museum. Masks are required. Please wear clothing which allows access to your shoulder. Vaccinations at this site are reserved for people who live and/or work in Washington State. All individuals 12 and over are eligible to get vaccinated. Those under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian or must get parental consent via video/phone call or paper format. La clínica de vacunación se llevara a cabo en Yakima Valley Museum. Se requieren máscaras. Por favor, use ropa que permita acceso a su brazo. Las vacunas en este sitio están reservadas para las personas que viven o trabajan en el estado de Washington. Todas las personas mayores de 12 años son elegibles para vacunarse. Los menores de 18 años deben estar acompañados por un padre/tutor o deben obtener el consentimiento de los padres por video/llamada telefónica o en papel.***1st & 2nd DOSE PFIZER VACCINATIONS!!!!***!!!!VACUNAS DE PRIMERA Y SEGUNDA DOSIS PFIZER!!!
special: If you are signing up for a second dose, you must get the same vaccine brand as your first dose.

name: Pe Ell Senior Center Clinic
info: ****This is a JOHNSON & JOHNSON single dose vaccine clinic. **** and is by appointment or walk in. Please note: Johnson & Johnson vaccine can only be administered to individuals 18 years of age or older according CDC requirements. This clinic is located at and hosted by Pe Ell Senior Center in partnership with Lewis County Public Health and Social Services, WA Department of Health and WA National Guard. This is a walk-up location. Please let us know if you or someone you are accompanying needs assistance of any kind. **You should also plan your visit around waiting for 15 minutes in the observation area so we can monitor for any unlikely adverse reactions to the vaccine.** Certain people with pre-identified conditions or past anaphylaxis events may be asked to wait for 30 minutes of observation. Free language translation services are provided. Video ASL translation is also provided. Please do not come if you are feeling ill. It is best to wear clothes that will allow for access to your upper arm, just below the shoulder. **Masks are required. If you do not have a mask, one will be provided.
special: If you are signing up for a second dose, you must get the same vaccine brand as your first dose.
